result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Elisha M D Bias in court.  Attorney Marshall Lemaster Belton in court for Elisha M D Bias.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn posted cash bail from fraudulent funds. Argument by Atty Belton. Defn unable to personally post the cash that was fraudulently posted. Argument by ADA Olsen; State request defn post the cash that was posted fraudulently. Defn request cash bond be reduced to the amount that wasn't posted fraudulently with PTS. CT makes findings and orders defn post the cash that was previously posted fraudulently. Defn to post $500 cash. BAIL TO BE POSTED ONLY IN CASH OR CERTIFIED FUNDS. Fraudlently posted bond to
be refunded to Allpaid. Defn taken into custody.
